code_snippet:
import os
import subprocess
from subprocess import PIPE
import sys

# ... (other imports and code omitted for brevity)

def _env_bool_value(env_name, default):
    """Parses a bool option from an environment variable"""
    return os.environ.get(env_name, default).upper() not in ["FALSE", "0", ""]

# ... (other global variables and code omitted for brevity)

def check_linker_need_libatomic():
    """Test if linker on system needs libatomic."""
    code_test = (
        b"#include <atomic>\n"
        + b"int main() { return std::atomic<int64_t>{}; }"
    )
    cxx = os.environ.get("CXX", "c++")
    cpp_test = subprocess.Popen(
        [cxx, "-x", "c++", "-std=c++17", "-"],
        stdin=PIPE,
        stdout=PIPE,
        stderr=PIPE,
    )
    cpp_test.communicate(input=code_test)
    if cpp_test.returncode == 0:
        return False
    # Double-check to see if -latomic actually can solve the problem.
    # https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/22491
    cpp_test = subprocess.Popen(
        [cxx, "-x", "c++", "-std=c++17", "-", "-latomic"],
        stdin=PIPE,
        stdout=PIPE,
        stderr=PIPE,
    )
    cpp_test.communicate(input=code_test)
    return cpp_test.returncode == 0

pattern_analysis.contextual_code:
import os
import subprocess
from subprocess import PIPE

def _env_bool_value(env_name, default):
    """Parses a bool option from an environment variable"""
    return os.environ.get(env_name, default).upper() not in ["FALSE", "0", ""]

def check_linker_need_libatomic():
    """Test if linker on system needs libatomic."""
    code_test = (
        b"#include <atomic>\n"
        + b"int main() { return std::atomic<int64_t>{}; }"
    )
    cxx = os.environ.get("CXX", "c++")
    cpp_test = subprocess.Popen(
        [cxx, "-x", "c++", "-std=c++17", "-"],
        stdin=PIPE,
        stdout=PIPE,
        stderr=PIPE,
    )
    cpp_test.communicate(input=code_test)
    if cpp_test.returncode == 0:
        return False
    # Double-check to see if -latomic actually can solve the problem.
    cpp_test = subprocess.Popen(
        [cxx, "-x", "c++", "-std=c++17", "-", "-latomic"],
        stdin=PIPE,
        stdout=PIPE,
        stderr=PIPE,
    )
    cpp_test.communicate(input=code_test)
    return cpp_test.returncode == 0
